trans-unit.source: Renders the 2-D children within the specified 3-D viewport bounds.
Viewport2DVisual3D enables you to place interactive 2-D content on a 3-D object.
Its counterpart is the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual> class, which is a 2-D visual with 3-D children.
Viewport2DVisual3D is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D"></xref> class.
Viewport2DVisual3D is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
Gets or sets a cached representation of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D"></xref>.
Set the CacheMode property when you need to increase performance for content that is time-consuming to render.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCache>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D> class projects 3-D content into 2-D to size the 2-D content in the 3-D element correctly.

Because caching always relies on the elementâ€™s size, instead of the transform applied to it, when you set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.CacheMode> property, initially your content may appear pixilated.
This is because it is being upsampled to a much larger size than it was cached at.

You can correct this situation by increasing the local size of your 2-D visual by setting the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Height%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Width%2A> properties.
Also, you can increase the <xref:System.Windows.Media.BitmapCache.RenderAtScale%2A> on the CacheMode until the content reaches an acceptable level of clarity.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.CacheMode"></xref> that holds a cached representation of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D.CacheMode*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the 3-D geometry for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D"></xref>.
Geometry is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
The 3-D geometry for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D.Geometry*> dependency property.
GeometryProperty is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
To be added.
Gets the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D.IsVisualHostMaterial*> attached property for a specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref>.
GetIsVisualHostMaterial is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
The element from which the property value is read.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D.IsVisualHostMaterial*> property value for the element.
To be added.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D.IsVisualHostMaterial*> attached property.
IsVisualHostMaterialProperty is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
To be added.
Gets or sets the material that describes the appearance of the 3-D object.
You must set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D.IsVisualHostMaterial%2A> attached property on the material on which you wish to have the 2-D visual placed.
Material is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
The material for the 3-D object.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D.Material*> dependency property.
MaterialProperty is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
To be added.
Sets the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D.IsVisualHostMaterial*> attached property to a specified element.
SetIsVisualHostMaterial is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
The element to which the attached property is written.
The required <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D.IsVisualHostMaterial*> value.
Gets or sets the 2-D visual to be placed on the 3-D object.
The visual is first applied to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VisualBrush>, which is then used on the 3-D object.
Visual is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
The visual to be placed on the 3-D object.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport2DVisual3D.Visual*> dependency property.
VisualProperty is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
To be added.
